item.title: Electronic Engine Control (EEC) Systems – PW Control Channels – THRUST REVERSER OPERATIVE

remarks.para: Except for ER operations, one control channel may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated thrust reverser is verified to be operative or is deactivated, and
Appropriate AOM performance adjustments are applied. (See LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES.)
Max thrust takeoff only.
Use of auto throttle not permitted. (Disarm auto throttle).
Use LIMITATIONS/PERFORMANCE PENALTIES as required.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.
No dispatch with two or more engine controls advisory messages displayed.
No dispatch with any reverser message displayed for operative reverser.
Max thrust takeoff only.
Use of auto throttle not permitted.
Takeoff weight penalty:
If runway is OBST (obstacle) limited, determine max allowable takeoff weight using Derate 2 Airport Analysis page.

note.para: Takeoff must be accomplished using max takeoff thrust.

numlitem.para: If runway is OBST limited and an OCA exists, reduce max allowable takeoff weight by 9,400 lbs.
If runway is not OBST limited and no OCA exists, reduce max allowable takeoff weight as shown below for the published runway performance limit:
TIRE: -2,400 lbs.
VMBE: -2,400 lbs.
RNWY: -2,400 lbs.
CLB: -5,600 lbs.
Method 1/Method 2 Terrain Clearance weight penalty: Reduce one engine inoperative terrain clearance weight by 8,600 lbs.
Landing weight penalty: Reduce climb limit weight for landing by 6,000 lbs.
Takeoff thrust is limited to 5 minute duration.

placard.para: Placard Electronic Engine Control (EEC) system(s) "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: With two or more of the following messages, dispatch is not permitted (ENGINE CONTROLS advisory message is displayed if on the ground with both engines running).

entry.para: L or R ENG PRI CONT
L or R ENG SEC CONT
L or R ENG SEC SEL

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: One EEC channel is considered to be inoperative with any of the following STATUS messages displayed:

entry.para: L or R ENG PRI CONT
L or R ENG SEC CONT
L or R ENG SEC SEL

numlitem.para: With two or more of these messages dispatch is not permitted (ENGINE CONTROLS advisory message is displayed if on the ground with both engines running).
Dispatch with one channel inoperative is allowed with the following conditions:
Select the EICAS EPCS page on the EICAS MAINT panel (P61).
Record any EEC related status messages in the Aircraft Maintenance Logbook.
ENG SEC SEL

With this message displayed on the ground, position the EEC MAINT CHANNEL SEL switch on the EEC Maintenance Panel (P61) to the AUTO mode. This step may clear the message. If the message remains dispatch is allowed. The primary channel on the affected engine will not be available.
ENG SEC CONT

If L ENG SEC CONT is displayed, position the EEC MAINT CHANNEL SEL switch on the EEC Maintenance Panel (P61) to the AUTO mode, then open and collar LEFT EEC CHANNEL SEL circuit breaker on the P11 panel (L7).

If R ENG SEC CONT is displayed, position the EEC MAINT CHANNEL SEL switch on the EEC Maintenance Panel (P61) to the AUTO mode, then open and collar RIGHT EEC CHANNEL SEL circuit breaker on the P11 panel (L34).
Verify that the primary EEC channel is in control of the affected engine:
Move the EEC POWER switch on the EEC Maintenance Panel (P61) to the ALTN position.
Select the EICAS EPCS page on the EICAS MAINT panel (P61).
Verify that a white box is displayed around PRI on the affected engine on the EPCS page.
Move the EEC POWER switch to the NORM position.
ENG PRI CONT –
On Maintenance panel P61:
At EEC Maintenance Panel, place EEC power switch to ALTN.
At EICAS MAINT panel, select EPCS page.
One EICAS Display Screen EPCS page:
Check for message S351-23.
Check for message S351-24.
If either message is present, DISPATCH IS PROHIBITED.
If neither messages are displayed, dispatch is allowed.
On maintenance panel P61:
At EEC Maintenance Panel, place EEC power switch to NORM.
Verify the thrust reverser operates normally or deactivate thrust reverser per DDG 78-31-1.
Make sure the thrust levers are in the idle position.

caution.para: DO NOT EXTEND THE THRUST REVERSER WHILE THE CORE COWL PANEL IS OPENED. DAMAGE TO THRUST REVERSER AND CORE COWL PANELS CAN OCCUR.

numlitem.para: Make sure the thrust reverser halves are closed.
Make sure the core cowl panels are closed.

warning.para: THE THRUST REVERSER WILL AUTOMATICALLY RETRACT IF THE ELECTRICAL POWER TO THE EEC/THRUST REVERSER CONTROL SYSTEM IS TURNED OFF OR IF THE EEC MAINT POWER SWITCH IS MOVED TO NORM POSITION. THE ACCIDENTAL OPERATION OF THE THRUST REVERSER CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS OR DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT.

numlitem.para: For the affected engine:
Move the EEC MAINT CHANNEL SEL L(R) switch to the AUTO position.
Verify the L(R) ENG fire handle is in NORM position.
For the affected engine, make sure these circuit breakers on the main distribution panel P6 are closed:
FUEL COND CONT L(R)
T/L INTERLOCK L(R)
L(R) ENG ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROL ALTN PWR
SYNC-LOCK LEFT (RIGHT) ENG
Make sure these circuit breakers on the overhead panel P11 are closed:
AIR/GND SYS 1
AIR/GND SYS 2
For the affected engine, make sure these circuit breakers on the overhead panel P11 are closed:
LEFT (RIGHT) ENGINE PDIU
LEFT (RIGHT) ENGINE THRUST REVERSER PRI CONT
LEFT (RIGHT) ENGINE THRUST REVERSER SEC CONT
LEFT (RIGHT) ENGINE THRUST REVERSER CONT/SCAV PRESS
LEFT (RIGHT) ENGINE T/R IND
Make sure the EICAS circuit breakers (6 locations) are closed.
Supply electrical power.
Supply hydraulic pressure to the engine thrust reverser system.
Move the EEC POWER switch on the EEC Maintenance Panel (P61) to the ALTN position.
Make sure that the "REV" indication and the L(R) REV ISLN VAL advisory message do not show on the EICAS.

warning.para: MAKE SURE THE AREA AROUND THE THRUST REVERSERS ARE CLEAR OF PERSONS AND EQUIPMENT. THE STEPS THAT FOLLOW WILL CAUSE THE THRUST REVERSERS TO EXTEND. FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS TO DEACTIVATE THE SPOILER/SPEEDBRAKE. IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THE INSTRUCTIONS, INJURY TO PERSONS OR DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT CAN OCCUR.

numlitem.para: Move the reverse thrust lever to the interlock position.
Make sure that the L(R) REV ISLN VAL advisory message does not show on the EICAS.
Make sure that the green REV indication does show on the EICAS.
Move the reverse thrust lever to the forward idle position.
Make sure that the L(R) REV ISLN VAL advisory message and the L(R) REV STOW SIG status message are not shown on the EICAS.
If thrust reverser has been deactivated, verify thrust control operates normally.
On center pedestal, advance thrust levers to full forward thrust position.
On EICAS display screen EPCS Page:
Verify Thrust Lever Resolver (TLR) measurements are between 80.5 and 83 degrees.
On center pedestal, move thrust levers to the idle position.
On EICAS screen EPCS Page:
Verify TLR measurements read 38 +/- 0.25 degrees.
Verify Thrust Reverser Position (RVA) is 0 +/- 2.0 is displayed for both engines.
Return aircraft to normal configuration.
On maintenance panel P61:
At EEC Maintenance Panel, verify EEC power switch is in NORM.
Check that throttles are at idle.
